tasks.title: Set up project structure and dependencies
tasks.description: Initialize the backend and frontend project structures, install required libraries and tools as specified in the technical stack.
tasks.details: For backend: Use Roswell to set up SBCL Common Lisp project with ASDF system definition. Install Hunchentoot, Hunchensocket, cl-sqlite, Jonathan, Ironclad, Bordeaux-threads via Quicklisp. For frontend: Initialize Vite project with PixiJS v7, vanilla JavaScript ES6+. subtasks.title: Initialize backend project structure with Roswell and SBCL

subtasks.title: Set up Docker environment with Debian base
subtasks.description: Create a Docker setup using Debian base image to containerize the project, ensuring both backend and frontend can run within the container.

tasks.title: Implement database schema and setup
tasks.description: Create and initialize the SQLite database with the required tables for users, sessions, and canvas states.
tasks.details: Use cl-sqlite to execute the schema.sql file creating users, sessions, and canvas_states tables. Include indexes for performance. Ensure database file is created in data/ directory. Implement utility functions in database.lisp for connecting and executing queries.
tasks.testStrategy: Run SQLite commands to verify tables exist and constraints are enforced. Insert test data and query to confirm integrity.

subtasks.title: Create schema.sql file with table definitions
subtasks.description: Define the SQL schema for users, sessions, and canvas_states tables including columns, data types, and constraints.

subtasks.title: Implement database connection utility
subtasks.description: Create functions in database.lisp to establish a connection to the SQLite database.

subtasks.title: Execute schema.sql to initialize database
subtasks.description: Run the schema.sql file to create the tables and indexes in the database.
subtasks.details: Implement a function in database.lisp that reads and executes the schema.sql file using the established database connection. Ensure all tables are created with their indexes and constraints.
subtasks.testStrategy: After execution, query the database to confirm that tables users, sessions, and canvas_states exist with the correct columns and indexes.

subtasks.title: Implement query execution utilities
subtasks.description: Add functions for executing SQL queries and statements in database.lisp.

subtasks.testStrategy: Write and execute test queries to insert sample data into the tables and retrieve it, verifying that the utilities work correctly and data integrity is maintained.

subtasks.title: Verify database setup and file location
subtasks.description: Ensure the database file is correctly placed and the setup is complete.
subtasks.details: Check that the SQLite database file is created in the data/ directory. Run a final verification to ensure all tables, indexes, and constraints are properly set up and functional.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use SQLite commands to inspect the database file, confirm table structures, and perform basic operations to ensure everything is working as expected.

subtasks.title: Implement user registration endpoint

subtasks.title: Implement logout endpoint and session management

tasks.title: Implement authentication frontend
tasks.description: Create the login/register modal UI and logic for handling authentication on the client side.
tasks.details: In auth.js, build modal with tabs for login/register, fields for email, password, username. Use fetch API to call backend endpoints. Store sessionId in localStorage. Block canvas access until authenticated. Handle errors and display messages.

subtasks.title: Create modal UI structure with tabs
subtasks.description: Build the basic HTML structure for the authentication modal including tabs for login and register.
subtasks.details: In auth.js, create a modal element with two tabs: one for login and one for register. Use CSS to style the modal as an overlay that appears when authentication is required. Ensure the modal is hidden by default and can be toggled.
subtasks.testStrategy: Open the app and verify the modal appears with login and register tabs visible.

subtasks.title: Add form fields for login and register
subtasks.description: Implement input fields for email, password, and username in the respective tabs.

subtasks.testStrategy: Switch between tabs and confirm fields are present and functional.

subtasks.title: Implement fetch API calls to backend endpoints
subtasks.description: Set up logic to send POST requests to /api/login and /api/register using fetch API.
subtasks.details: On form submission, collect form data and use fetch to call the appropriate backend endpoint. Handle the response asynchronously. Prepare for storing sessionId on success.
subtasks.testStrategy: Submit forms with valid data and check network requests in browser dev tools.

subtasks.title: Handle authentication success and session storage
subtasks.description: Process successful login/register responses by storing sessionId and unblocking canvas access.
subtasks.details: Upon successful response, store the sessionId in localStorage. Hide the modal and allow access to the canvas. Check for existing sessionId on app load to skip modal if already authenticated.
subtasks.testStrategy: Register and login, then refresh the page to verify session persists and canvas is accessible.

subtasks.title: Implement error handling and message display
subtasks.description: Add logic to display error messages for failed authentication attempts.
subtasks.details: On failed responses, parse error messages from the backend and display them in the modal. Clear messages on successful attempts. Ensure the modal remains open on errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Attempt login/register with invalid credentials and verify error messages appear.

tasks.title: Implement canvas rendering with PixiJS

   - Background thread per canvas running at 60 Hz
   - Call `ecs:run-systems` with dt parameter
   - Delta broadcasting at 20 Hz (every 3rd tick)

- Physics state persists across server restarts

tasks.description: Optimize real-time synchronization, implement delta compression, add bandwidth and latency monitoring, create determinism tests, and perform load testing with multiple clients and 500+ balls.
tasks.details:
**Objective**: Ensure robust multiplayer experience with performance optimization.

**Key Deliverables**:

1. **Delta Compression Optimization**:
   - Only send changed properties (position, velocity, rotation)
   - Skip objects with velocity < 0.01 (sleeping)
   - Batch deltas into single message per broadcast
   - Measure bandwidth reduction (target: <280 KB/sec per client)

   - Identify bottlenecks and optimize hot paths
   - Document performance results in .taskmaster/docs/

5. **Error Handling**:
   - Handle WebSocket disconnection during physics simulation
   - Graceful degradation: disable ghost prediction if server lags
   - Add reconnection recovery (full state sync on reconnect)

**Success Criteria**:
- Bandwidth reduced by >50% compared to full state broadcasting
- Server maintains 60 Hz simulation with 500 balls across 2 clients
- Determinism test passes 100% of time
- Perceived latency <50ms for ghost spawns
- No visual artifacts during reconnection
